summary:
I like to make silly things, and I also like to put in minimal effort for those silly things. 
I also like to make things in Rust, mostly for the web, and this is where we run into a problem. 
See, if I want to make something for the web, I could use Django but I don't want that...
title: Rust needs a web framework for lazy developers

summary:
Courtney Cassidy writes about her experience transitioning out of the tech industry, the joys of gardening, and cultivating space for an intentional life. 

The most important discovery I made, though, was that I could go into the garden feeling unwell after a day spent on the computer, and within twenty minutes I would feel joy and peace.  It was transformative...
title: Growing beyond the computer

summary: For years now, AI has undermined the public‚Äôs ability to trust what it sees, hears, and reads.  The Republican National Committee released a provocative ad offering an ‚ÄúAI-generated look into the country‚Äôs possible future if Joe Biden is re-elected,‚Äù showing apocalyptic, machine-made images of ruined cityscapes and chaos at the border.  Fake robocalls purporting to be from Biden urged New Hampshire residents not to vote in the 2024 primary election...
title: AI and the 2024 US Elections
